concept.title: Architectural clock gating modes
concept.shortdesc: When the Cortex‑A76 core is in standby mode, it is architecturally clock gated at the top of the clock tree.

conbody.p: Wait for Interrupt (WFI) and Wait for Event (WFE) are features of Armv8‑A architecture that put the core in a low-power standby mode by architecturally disabling the clock at the top of the clock tree. The is fully powered and retains all the state in standby mode.

link.desc: WFI puts the core in a low-power state by disabling most of the clocks in the core, while keeping the core powered up.

WFE is a feature of the Armv8‑A architecture. It uses a locking mechanism based on events, to put the core in a low-power state by disabling most of the clocks in the core, while keeping the core powered up.
